alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 8:24AM CDT until March 24 at 11:50AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, minor flooding occurs near the gage site and affects low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Wednesday was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 4.2 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 830 AM CDT.
